9.1. Consider a renewal process {N(t),t ≥ 0} having following distribution for inter-arrival times. Then
simulate the renewal process for 0 ≤ t ≤ y.
a) N(µ = 2,σ2 = 0.0625) & y = 5 
b) Gamma(α = 2,β = 2) & y = 10
c) LN(µ = 0.5,σ2 = 0.0025) & y = 7
d) Uniform(0,5) & y = 15
```{r}
#A)
mu=2;time=5;
inter=rnorm(20,2,sqrt(0.0625));
arr=cumsum(inter)
arr=arr[arr<time]
n=length(arr)
Nt=seq(0,n)
t1=c(0,arr)
ti=c("<=t",n+1)
t2=c(arr,time)
dat=data.frame("start"=round(t1,3),ti,"to"=round(t2,3),Nt)
dat
#b)
alpha=2;beta=2;t=10;
inter=rgamma(n=200,alpha,beta);
arr=cumsum(inter)
arr=arr[arr<time]
n=length(arr)
Nt=seq(0,n)
t1=c(0,arr)
ti=c("<=t",n+1)
t2=c(arr,time)
data=data.frame("start"=round(t1,3),ti,"t0"=round(t2,3),Nt);
data;
#c)
mu=0.5;sig2=0.0025;t=5;
inter=rlnorm(n=20,mu,sqrt(sig2))
arr=cumsum(inter)
arr=arr[arr<time]
n=length(arr)
Nt=seq(0,n)
t1=c(0,arr)
ti=c("<=t",n+1)
t2=c(arr,time)
data=data.frame("start"=round(t1,3),ti,"t0"=round(t2,3),Nt);
data;
#d)
a=0; b=5; t=15; 
inter=runif(n=200,a,b)
arr=cumsum(inter)
arr=arr[arr<time]
n=length(arr)
Nt=seq(0,n)
t1=c(0,arr)
ti=c("<=t",n+1)
t2=c(arr,time)
data=data.frame("start"=round(t1,3),ti,"t0"=round(t2,3),Nt);
data;
#e)
lambda=2; t=5;
inter=rexp(n=2*lambda*t,rate=lambda);
arr=cumsum(arr)
arr=arr[arr<time]
n=length(arr)
Nt=seq(0,n)
t1=c(0,arr)
ti=c("<=t",n+1)
t2=c(arr,time)
data=data.frame("start"=round(t1,3),ti,"t0"=round(t2,3),Nt);
data

```
